awd_titl_txt: A Study of Equilibrium, Mass Transfer and Fixed Bed         Dynamic Phenomena in Recovery, Separation and Purification  of Amino Acids by Ion Exchange
awd_abstract_narration: This is a fundamental study of the important ion exchange processes             for protein separation.  Three major tasks are proposed for                     obtaining a complete understanding of the kinetic and transport                 processes as well as the bed dynamics.  A novel differential bed                is proposed for studying the ion exchange kinetics.  The primary                systems in the study are amino acids and amberlite resins.  The                 major processes to be studied are elution and displacement                      chromatographies.
org_div_long_name: Division of Chemical, Bioengineering, Environmental, and Transport Systems

inst.org_lgl_bus_name: RECTOR & VISITORS OF THE UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA
